turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about 2011–12 Detroit Titans men's basketball team.
turn.1: What happened in the second half against Valparaiso?
turn.2: Valpo retook a small lead early in the second half, but the Titans kept battling back in the first four minutes, leading to three lead changes before the media timeout.
turn.3: Did Detroit ever take the lead?
turn.4: After several more lead changes, the Crusaders took a six-point lead with 4:29 remaining.
turn.5: Did anyone else play in the second half?
turn.6: With the Titans down 67–63 with 2:33 to play, Chase Simon hit a three-pointer and Eli Holman hit a jumper after getting a blocked shot at the other end to take the lead 68–67 with 1:28 left.
turn.7: What else happened in the game?
turn.8: Ryan Brokehoff hit a jump shot to put Valparaiso back in front by 1, and Eli Holman countered by grabbing his own missed shot for an offensive rebound and hitting another big shot and successfully converted a three-point play to put the Titans back out in front 71–69 with 47 seconds left. The Crusaders' Jay Harris hit a layup to tie the game once again at 71–71, giving the Titans a chance to have the final shot with just 26 seconds remaining.
turn.9: Did he make any other shots?
turn.10: With still 10 seconds left, Chase Simon started driving inside the lane to the hoop, knocking a Valpo player over and being called for an offensive foul for charging.
turn.12: With 5 seconds still left on the clock, Erik Buggs drove the length of the court and hit a layup at the buzzer to give Valparaiso the victory 73–71.
